(Simplified: 镫)
Chinese Definition:
①掛在馬鞍兩旁的鐵製腳踏：馬鐙。鐙骨(聽骨之一，形狀像馬鐙)。
鐙骨 [ dèng gǔ ]: stapes or stirrup bone of middle ear, passing sound vibration to the inner ear

鐙字的基本解释

鐙
dèng

鐙字的汉语字典释义

[①]［dēng］
［《集韻》都騰切，平登，端。］
“镫1”的繁体字。
(1)本作“登”。瓦豆。古代陶制的食器，形似高足盘，或有盖。
(2)指这种食器的基部。
(3)膏镫。也称锭、钉、烛豆、烛盘。古代照明用具。青铜制，上有盘，中有柱，下有底。或有三足及柄。盘所以盛膏，或中有锥供插烛。
(4)泛指灯；油灯。
[②]［dèng］
［《廣韻》都鄧切，去嶝，端。］
亦作“1”。亦作“1”。“镫2”的繁体字。
挂在鞍子两旁的脚踏。多用铁制成。

鐙字的康熙字典解释

【戌集上】【金字部】　鐙； 康熙笔画：20； 页码：页1323第04
【唐韻】都滕切【集韻】【韻會】都騰切，?音登。【說文】錠也。【徐鉉曰】錠中置燭，故謂之鐙。今俗別作燈，非是。【楚辭·招魂】華鐙錯些。【劉公幹·贈五官中郞將詩】明鐙熺炎光。　又山名。【山海經】鼓鐙之山。　又與登同。【儀禮·公食大夫禮】實于鐙。【註】瓦豆謂之鐙。【疏】詩：于豆于登。毛傳：木曰豆，瓦曰登。【後漢·禮儀志】瓦鐙一，彤矢四。又【廣韻】都鄧切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】丁鄧切，?音嶝。【廣韻】鞍鐙。【集韻】馬鞁具。【正字通】馬鞍兩旁，足所踏也。【韓致堯詩】和裙穿玉鐙。　又【韻會】豆下跗。【禮·祭統】執鐙。【註】鐙，豆下跗也。【釋文】鐙，音登。又丁鄧反。

stirrup
Basic explanation of words
stirrup
dèng
stirrup
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［dēng］
["Ji Yun" are all cut, flat, and end. ]
Traditional characters for "镫1".
(1) This is "Login". Wadou. The ancient pottery utensils were shaped like high-footed dishes or had lids.
(2) Refers to the base of this kind of food container.
(3) Paste stirrup. Also called ingots, nails, candle beans, candle trays. Ancient lighting appliances. Made of bronze, with a plate on the top, a pillar in the middle, and a bottom on the bottom. Or have three legs and handles. The pan is filled with ointment, or there is a cone in it for inserting candles.
(4) refers to lamps; oil lamps.
[②]［dèng］
["Guangyun" all Dengqie, go to Deng, end. ]
Also called "1". Also called "1". Traditional characters for "镫2".
Pedals hanging on both sides of the saddle. Mostly made of iron.
stirrup
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Su Ji 1] [Golden Word Department] 　镫; Kangxi strokes: 20; Page number: page 1323 04
[Tang Yun] All Tengqie [Jiyun] [Yunhui] All Tengqie,? Yindeng. [Said Wen] Ingots too. [Xu Xuan said] The candle is placed in the ingot, so it is called the stirrup. Don't make a lamp today, it's true. [Songs of the Chu·Hun] Hua stirrup is wrong. 【Liu Gongqian · Poems of General Yin in the Five Senses Presented to the Five Senses】Ming Tiaoyu Yanguang.　Also the name of the mountain. 【Shan Hai Jing】The mountain of drum stirrup.　 Same with Deng again. 【Rituals·Public Food Doctor Ceremony】actually in stirrups. [Note] Wadou is called stirrup. [Sparse] Poem: Yu Dou Yu Deng. Mao Chuan: Mu is Dou, Wa Yuedeng. [Later Han·Etiquette] The tile stirrup is one, and the red arrow is four. Also [Guangyun] Du Dengqi [Jiyun] [Yunhui] [Zhengyun] Ding Dengqi,? Yindeng. [Guangyun] Saddle stirrup. 【Jiyun】Ma Yinggu. 【Zhengzitong】On both sides of the saddle, the foot can be stepped on. [Han Zhiyao Poems] Wear jade stirrups and skirts.　[Rhyme Club] The bean is under the halt. 【Ritual·Sacrificial System】hold the stirrup. [Note] Stirrup, tarsus under the bean. 【Explanation】Stirrup, Yindeng. Ding Deng turned against.
